name: The Fairmont Copley Plaza, Boston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here over the 4th of July holiday. Great service,clean rooms as well as the rest of the hotel. We were able to see the fireworks from the front of the hotel. Great view. Room was cleaned daily. The gold floor is a good idea. Breakfast and afternoon appitizers.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Fairmont Copley Plaza while I was in Boston on a business trip. It was my first time visiting Boston. I am a Fairmont president's club member and have have the pleasure of staying at many Fairmont properties in Canada and the United States. I am pleased to say that this was by far the best hotel stay I have ever had. The hotel setting was amazing and the service of all the staff at the hotel was phenomenal. From the bellmen, the front desk attendants, housekeeping and food and beverage staff, I was always made to feel like a valued guest of the hotel.
reviews.title: Most exceptional customer service of any Fairmont hotel I have stayed at

reviews.text: One night when I was dining in the Oak Bar, I asked the food and beverage manager where I could find a particular brand of cucumber vodka. Adam took the time to research the information for me and called a few liquor stores until he found a place where I could find it. Unfortunately when I took a taxi to the liquor store they were sold out. To my pleasant surprise, when I returned from my business meetings the next day, there was a bottle of vodka in my room for me. Adam had taken the time to find out another store that sold it and went out purchased a bottle for me.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay as expected, a little far from main attractions

reviews.text: This was one of the many shining examples of the amazing customer services of this hotel. As a result I know that I will go back and stay here again in the future.
reviews.title: All the right things - but at a price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Luxury is as expected. Check-in staff and concierge were top-notch. Staff remembering check-in notes about anniversary was a plus. No coffee in room, even upon request was a let down. $10 pot of coffee is a bit steep. Could have more working plugs in this day and age. Pay for internet is a bit passe. Amenities were a bit stingy. No refills or replacement after use, even though I had stayed for 3 nights. Location is a little far from the main attractions, so you will have to take either a tour or learn to use the subway. Management handled security well despite the raucous outside from the July 4th celebrations. Express check-out was painless.
reviews.title: Go only for the historic feel...otherwise, stay somewhere else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had the pleasure of staying at the Copley for 1 night on Saturday March 8 while attending a convention at the hotel. We reserved one of their ‘hotel within a hotel’ ‘Gold Signature’ rooms and highly recommend this added indulgence. After checking several web sites, we found the hotels own web site actually offered the best nightly rate for the Gold Signature accomodations and number of booking options.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay at the Copley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The interior of the hotel is elegantly appointed and reminiscent of a bygone golden age of lavish and extravagantly designed hotels. The staff were equally as attentive and professional as the ambiance was sophisticated.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: The Fairmont ‘Gold Signature’ level is on its own special floor (4th flr.) and provides a private check-in desk on the 4th floor just for guests staying on the Gold Signature floor. Amenities on this floor include a private, multiple room lounge area classically decorated complete with crackling fireplace and mantle, and a large pantry (the size of a standard kitchen). These rooms are all connected together in one area by doorways and create a sort of large square floor plan with each room decorated differently. One of the rooms was decorated in the style of a classic personal home Library and included books and a small collection of DVD’s that Gold guests can bring to their room which all include DVD players. There was also a large closet sized room with two computer stations with fax printers and free internet. High speed internet access is also included in all Gold Signature rooms.
reviews.title: Unfortunate experience
Beautiful, historic hotel - Great Back Bay location
reviews.text: During the morning and early evenings, the counters in the pantry are lined with a generous spread of complimentary food and drink, however, there is a significant collection of wine and liquor set up during most other hours of the day and evening. All food and non-alcoholic drinks are complimentary, but the liquor is an ‘Honor Bar’ in which guests mix their own drinks from the well stocked collection of full size liquor bottles and are ‘requested’ to write on a provided piece of paper any alcohol that they take which is charged to your room. As the pantry is unsupervised (except for the occasional staff person checking to ensure nothing needs refilling), they don’t seem to police the policy, but do appeal to people’s honesty in abiding by the honor system.

reviews.title: Great location for a tourist. V.comfy bed. Try the "Fairmont Gold"
reviews.text: At 5:00, the pantry was setup with a very nice number hors d'oeuvres including imported cheeses & crackers, scallops wrapped in bacon, spinach stuffed puff pastry, humus, prosciutto and cheese stuffed hot peppers, and many other items. Breakfast consisted of both hot and cold items including your standard breads, pastries, croissant, eggs bacon, home fries, smoked salmon, yogurt and granola parfait, fruits and cereals as well as other items. During all times of day there was an endless supply of juices, soda, and water. Several newspapers were also available for guests relaxing in the Gold lounge.

I had the pleasure of spending 3 days at the beautiful Fairmont Copely Hotel. Being my first visit to Boston, my expectations of the hotel were very high as I spent a lot of time researching where to stay. The hotel not only lived up to, but surpassed my expectations.
reviews.title: Lovely Boston Hotel

reviews.text: I had booked a room on the Fairmont Gold Floor which I would recommend to everyone. It is a little more expensive, but worth every penny. As I arrived four hours before check in, I was expecting to have to wait for my room. However, upon arrival to the private Gold Floor reception, I was warmly greeted by Brad, Gold Floor Manager, who promptly told me that not only was my room ready, but had been upgraded to a larger room overlooking Copely Square. I was then given a tour of the floor and all of its amenities and then shown my room.
reviews.title: Great location, recently renovated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was very spacious and inviting. The bathroom was large, clean and very well appointed. I especially loved the paint color of the bedroom room and the gorgeous marble tiles and coloring of the bathroom. Everything was new and clean with the hotel just completing its major renovation only two weeks prior.
reviews.title: Very nice grand old hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As far as the gold floor amenities, the Fairmont really has thought of everything. The breakfast every morning in the lounge was excellent with different items each day. The afternoon appetizers each afternoon were also amazing and showed off the local flavor and speciaties of the Boston area. The kitchen is open all day for beverages (both alcoholic and nonalcoholic) and snacks. There is an honor bar for wine or spirits. In the lounge, there are plent of books, news papers, magazines, CDs, DVDs, etc. to use or borrow for our room during your stay.
reviews.title: Charming and comfortable
Problem handled very well
reviews.text: Brad and the Gold Floor staff are fantastic. After spending about 45 minutes with me going over a very wide variety of sightseeing options in the Boston Area, Brad arranged dinner reservations each evening at some great resturants and made suggestions for lunch spots throughout the city during my travels. Each day, Brad and the staff would check with me to see how my experience was at their recommended spots. They were all fantastic!
The service was great
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.title: Much Needed Renovation

reviews.text: The rooms were very clean
reviews.title: Nice stay after rough start

reviews.text: The rooms were also fabulous
reviews.title: Infrequent traveler loving the luxury!

reviews.text: The beds were comfertable but there needs to be more beds in the room
reviews.title: 100 Years and Still the Best in Town

reviews.text: I loved staying in this hotel. I was booked here purely by accident for the final night of a week-long business trip to Boston, and loved it. The service was top-notch, the room was plush, and the amenities left nothing to be desired. I would stay here again under any circumstances. I loved the room's decor and layout; the bathroom was stunningly designed (I even took photos for inspiration in my own home), and of course the hotel itself is remarkable to behold. The location is certainly convenient to many Boston attractions, such as the Public Garden. Great hotel.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel, extraordinary experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On approach to this hotel i wasnt really impressed by the exterior . While fine it just didn't seem to live up to the pictures I'd seen on the hotel website.
reviews.title: Fantastic olde world charm

reviews.text: Well the old phrase, never judge a book by its cover was never more appropiate.
reviews.title: Magnificient hotel with superb service

Thirty inutes later i enquired if it was ready yet and they were extremely appologetic as it was not and handed me a token for free drinks.
reviews.title: Great location and service

reviews.text: This was no hardship as the Oak Bar was beautifully resting with oak panneling and tradionally furnished in a gentleman club type manner or in a very tradional London hotel style manner.

reviews.text: of the Copley Plaza Mall and still within easy
reviews.title: A hotel with Character

likes.liked: — Location and size of the room

reviews.text: Okay, first the good - the "deluxe" room I had was quite large, including the bathroom, and the bed was the best I have slept on in some time. The bathrobes were also a nice touch, and my view of Copley Square was fantastic. Now the bad: there were no rooms available when I arrived around noon - I know checkin at most hotels isn't until 3:00 or so but 99.9% of the time they have rooms available; I was able to check into Nine Zero at 10:30 a.m. when I stayed there. So I kept checking in (they did offer to call my cell phone but I didn't think it would be that long) and finally at 3:00 I was told a room was ready; however when I got up to the room housekeeping was still in there so I had to go back to the lobby and wait another 15 minutes. There is no coffee in the room; minor, I know but most hotels have free coffee. They offered to bring a coffee machine with the "set-up" to your room for $10 plus taxes, etc. I also didn't receive a newspaper even though when I made my reservation through the Fairmont site they asked what type of paper I wanted (national or local). For those of you who don't wash your face in the shower, the sink in the bathroom is an adventure to use (don't bump your head!) and for a hotel that has great views, I don't understand why the chair is situated on the opposite side of the room by the door; I'd rather sit in a chair by the window so I can enjoy the view. The lobby is not set up right to me; the only place for people to sit is on the opposite side of checkin near a reception room and if there is an event going on (as there was on the day I stayed) you have to hear the noise from the room. Finally, a treat for me is to order room service breakfast; don't bother. Two eggs, toast, ham, coffee and juice (no mention of potatoes on the menu I had) for $21 plus room service fee, gratuity, taxes, etc. which by my calculations would bring the total close to $30! A big disappointment and I would not likely stay there again, even with the reduced rate I paid.
reviews.title: Disappointed - luxury must mean few amenities

reviews.text: We booked three rooms here for two nights after my son's graduation and had a very good experience. Had been told that THE place to stay was the Ritz but after looking at the Fairmont's website and finding a summer special price of just $229 a night compared to the Ritz at $400+ I chose the Fairmont and was pleased. The FCP has been recently renovated and our room was huge and had a wonderful bed, beautiful linens and a lovely marble bathroom. When we were leaving to go to the airport, the head doorman went WAY out of his way to call several taxi companies for us and get us a minivan cab - when one arrived he refused a tip and told us to tip the guy carrying the luggage instead. Also, they have an adorable black lab that is their canine ambassador - a nice touch to make people feel at home. I would stay here again and probably would try some of their other properties.
reviews.title: Great price on their website!
The Bed Where Angels Fear to Tread
reviews.text: At the last minute my husband and I decided to stay in the city after a wedding last weekend, and we chose the Fairmont. While we've stayed there often, this was our first visit to the new Gold Floor. Lots of hotel chains are now barking about their heavenly beds, well, no hotel I've been in holds a candle to the linens and bedding at the Fairmont. Really, I had flashbacks all the next day wishing I was back in the sack at the Fairmont.

The hotel feels as if it was just totally renovated. Everything in the room was new and top quality. Time was, I used to feel insulted when I was given a room without a view, and our room this weekend was an interior room. but QUIET! It was like being way out in the country. No city noises at all.
reviews.title: Excellent, as Expected
Fairmont Copley Plaza
reviews.text: The gold floor has a great club kind of thing. It's about five different (all very elegant) sitting rooms with something for everyone -- fireplace, computers, butler's pantry, TV. whatever you're in the mood for.

reviews.title: Hotel was fine but staff was excellent
reviews.text: After receiving notice from the Westin across the street I would be moved 3 times during my week long stay, I called the Fairmont. Nothing but we would be glad to help, no moves and that I should consider the small upcharge for the Gold Floor.

reviews.title: Fabulous Fairmont
reviews.text: That was the best move. Staff was wonderful addressing me by name each and every day. Honor bar, 4 different rooms in the lounge, food out all time.

reviews.title: fantastic hotel
reviews.text: A home away from home. While other hotels may have the views the staff is tops.

On the wasy to a wedding on the Cape, we thought we would treat ourselves to a night at one of Boston "Grand Dame" Hotels. Choosing the Fairmont Copley Plaza because of its excellent downtown location and proximity to the Amtrak station, (walking distance), we arrived at the Fairmont feeling chilly and less than elegant. Nevertheless, we were immediately swept into the warmth of the hotel by the excellent door personnel and after nary a request, shown to the Fairmont's Gold Level on the 4th floor. The hospitality there only exceeded what we had experienced on our arrival: superior concierge service, an extensive pantry of food and drink, including an honor bar, a warm fireplace, and best of all a spacious room with a completely furnished, but comfortably old- fashioned bathroom. Breakfast the next morning was worth paying for, but again it was complimentary. Kudos to the excellent management of this hotel, and all the thoughtfulness of its service personnel and excellence of design. We'll be back. Oh, yes, the price was fair and reasonable. Sincerely, S&T B.
reviews.title: 4 star..... Are they Joking !!!!!

reviews.text: Although it was rainy and cold day at the end of may the Fairmont hotel was warm and friendly. The hotel was just so impeccably beautiful and the room so classy and homey. The bed was unbelievably comfortable. The service was also outstanding as was the restaurant. An added attraction for me was katie copley the black lab who greets you when you arrive. I have 2 labs myself so I was so excited. I had no idea it was a dog friendly hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location, Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: Have stayed here about 10 times in the past two years and feel like I know the place well. I would agree that certain house keeping issues are a concern at the Fairmont. When I arrived on this last trip, I found an old dust mop right in the hallway off the elevators (one of those yellow feathered things) and on my first day there, maid service did not show up until about 3:00. In addition, on my final morning, I had just stepped out of the shower and into a robe at 8:30 a.m. when there was an abrupt knock on the door. Before I had a chance to say anything (I was all wet and listeneing to the Today Show while drinking my coffee), a woman unlocked the door and walked into my room. I was so shocked and surprised I could barely react as this has NEVER happened before. She was in a uniform but there was no cleaning cart with her- I do not know who she was but it was totally uncalled for. I would recommend bolting the door. I had just gotten room service for breakfast and had not thought to do so. It was strange.
reviews.title: Repeat performance
For $84, I shouldn't complain...but MICE!
reviews.text: And room service trays are left in the hallway for WAY too long.

reviews.title: Nice but I've had better
reviews.text: Aside from that, things were fine. Catie Copley is now a huge celebrity and the kids all love her. It is sweet to see so many little ones running up to her. She makes the formaility of this place all more cozy in a way. Yes, the bathroom is a bit outdated and sometimes the sound level is poor, but something about the Fairmont keeps me coming back for more. It has amazing charisma and charm, and of course,the location is tops.

Let me start by saying I know I should not complain about staying at this hotel for $84 a night, as I found them through Priceline (I never thought a hotel of this caliber would be on that site!) but soemthings just aren't right, even at that price. When I arrived, there was no one to greet me and I struggled with my bags to the desk. I asked for an upgrade (and I was a little upset about having to lug my bags) and they put me on the Gold Floor...what a treat and it made me immediately forget about my poor reception! The room was ok, but the lounge and the service in the lounge was great, as well as the food.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel

reviews.text: Would I spend $300+ a night to be on the Concierge Floor, the normal rate,...no chance, would rather stay at the Ritz or Four Season. It was nice, but definately not great. But for $84 a night...it was a treat! The bathrooms was very small and not very clean...the hotel is just old and in need of a renovation/TLC as no one seems to care about dirty corridors, little tears and chips all over, chipped bath tub and peeling wallpaper. Nothing terrible, just not crisp as you would expect on a Concierge floor or at the Ritz/Four Seasons. But, the biggest issue was that I saw a mouse in the Oak Bar and also saw a mouse in my room! It was awful! I travel very frequently to city hotels and have never seen one in a hotel before! This would lead me to believe that they have cleanliness issues throughout the hotel and there were room service trays that stayed in the corridor for quite some time. I guess Mickey runs around looking for those leftovers. When I saw the rodent in the bar, I mentioned it to the waitress who basically shrugged her shoulders and said it is part of being in a big city...so I guess they had these complaints before.
reviews.title: You have to stay at this hotel!

reviews.text: In the course of covering the Winter Classic at Fenway Park, we chose the Fairmont Copley Plaza over the Westin, the hotel designated for media and are so grateful we did. We were fortunate enough to enjoy the concierge service of Fairmont Gold and our every request was granted quickly and pleasantly. Can't say enough about the customer service for all facets of the hotel and the almost 100 year old building is kept in an immaculate state. Indeed, the Fairmont Copley Plaza is our only choice for future stays in Boston and should be on every traveler's short list.
reviews.title: Excellent experience at the Fairmont

reviews.text: We couldn't fault any aspect of our stay. Stayed in a Gold Suite, which was huge, and had a great view of Copley Square.Staff were without fail friendly, courteous and professional. Enjoyed a wonderful breakfast in the Oak Room, where again the staff were most welcoming. We have now stayed in a number of historic Fairmont hotels, and we love them - they do a great job of retaining the ambience of the building, and upholding old-fashioned standrads of service, whilst offering all the comforts one would expect in a luxury hotel in the 21st Century. A difficult balance to achieve.
reviews.title: Grand Old Hotel which lives up to its history

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is beautiful. The desk agents and concierge were very helpful and polite. Service and food in the lounge was very good. The valets and doormen were spotty.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, service mixed, rooms small and noisy with a smell

reviews.text: The rooms were nicely decorated but on the small side and without good sound proofing from hallway noise and adjoining rooms. Also there was an odor in the room like the kitchen was being vented directly into it. It was like chicken frying in old oil. Ahd this was on the "Gold Concierge Floor".
reviews.title: Far exceeded all expectations - Gold staff & concierge, amenities, cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was excellent. Overall, if not for the smell in the room which was really quite strong, would have been an excellend stay.
reviews.title: Loved our stay --- with a couple of 'nits

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the hotel. The standard room although renovated was still shabby in some detail. The room is uncomfortable other than for sleeping. No place to sit. Extremely over priced even at a discounted rate I received.
reviews.title: Over rated Over Priced

reviews.text: This is a clean and elegant hotel in a great location BUT if a hotel is going to charge 5 star rates, it has to deliver 5 star rooms and ours was not. It was tiny. Worse, the small closet was completely taken up by the mini bookcase containing the safe. Our clothes could not hang all the way down. The bathroom is also tiny and to make matters worse, there is no place in the bathroom for any toiletries or other supplies. There is only one shelf and the sink. All of our things were on the one small shelf and the desk in the room. For these prices, you can do better in the area.
reviews.title: Not a true 5 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 5 nights at the end of our New England tour to celebrate 'molecatcher's' 60th Birthday! We had booked a room on the 'Gold' floor (well worth the extra) but were disappointed to be given an inside room with a view overlooking the central well and the noisy extractor vents. We were told that the hotel was full and we could not be moved for 2 days, but after our first sleepless night we threatened to check out unless an alternative was offered. The Gold Team were extremely helpful and came up with a delightful front room along with a bottle of wine on ice and a box of chocolates to celebrate the Birthday! After this faulty start everything was perfect and we had a wonderful stay in Boston. The breakfasts and evening canapes were outstanding with 24 hour access to free chilled soft drinks and an extensive honesty bar. There are 2 PCs in the lounge with free internet access in addition to WiFi for laptops in each bedroom. We mostly ate out but on our last night enjoyed a memorable meal in the Oak Room Restaurant (huge portions) beautifully cooked and well served.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, very central.

likes.disliked: — The first room we were allocated!

reviews.text: We looked into several other Boston Hotels but none were as elegant as the Fairmont and we would certainly stay here again on a future visit, happily paying the extra for the 'Gold' floor.
reviews.title: Great hotel, superb location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived after a good flight from London at about 2.30 in the afternoon, unfortunately our room was not ready, and would not be ready till about 4, 1 hour after it should have been. Not a great start but we were in an upbeat mood, so we went for a wander to get our bearings and pick up some brochures on the freedom trail etc.
reviews.title: very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night 7/19 as we were going to Fenway to see the Red Sox that night. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful and grand. There are beautiful flowers everywhere and I love the hotel's dog who sits in the lobby. When we checked in they would not honor any upgrade (probably because we got the room on priceline) so we were stuck with a moderate queen room. It was a very small room on the second floor with no view. It was very clean and the decor was nice but it was very small. That was the only draw back to the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful and the location is wonderful. The T is right across the street as well as the Hancock tower. They would not let us into the oak room for last call because they said that we were too late( 12:10) so we went across the street to the Westin. Overall a nice hotel but if you are looking for a nice room with great views of the city try the Westin across the street. It's rooms are much nicer,they have better facilities (they have a pool) and they have a very fun and lively bar that is open later than the Fairmonts.
reviews.title: Great old hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed in many old "grand dame" hotels -- the Waldorf-Astoria, the Willard, etc., and I was a bit leary of the Fairmont Copley Plaza. Sure it had a great location and reputation, but I've always been disappointed in the past with these older hotels. All in all I needn't have worried, however. The bed and bedding was excellent, perhaps consistently (all 6 nights) the best hotel sleep I've had.
reviews.title: Best old lady I've seen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd probably go so far as 5 stars, but for a couple complaints regarding the bathroom -- we apparently were put in the handicap-accessible room (which is fine), but there was no way to prop open the bathroom door (it was on a strong springed hinge -- how do people in wheelchairs even manage?), and the bath vent fan wasn't working. This made for stuffy times in the bathroom, particularly on humid late June afternoons.
reviews.title: Go for a cocktail, stay somewhere else
The "Moderate" Rooms are very bad!
reviews.text: Then there were what appears to be a common feature nowadays -- the stray hair that's obviously not yours. (We were two short-haired men staying in the room, so I know the foot-long black curl was not ours!) I don't know if I've ever been to a hotel where the bathroom cleanliness met my expectations, but at the Fairmont Copley Plaza the truly bizarre thing was that the number of extraneous hairs *increased* from day to day. Was the maid pulling out her own hair in frustration at the spring-loaded door? Was the Fairmont laundry not up to the challenge of removing hair from towels and mats? Who knows, but I know taht I was oscillating between disgusted and amused as the amount of stray hair increased over our 6 days.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had stayed here 7 years ago, and it was not good to go back. This hotel is a sad shadow of its former glory, living on a reputation its not keeping up.
reviews.title: Go for the Gold Floor

likes.liked: — The hotel within a hotel concept

reviews.text: Found a great rate and enjoyed our stay due to the location, but was quite suprised at the work that was needed on this hotel. I have stayed at other Fairmont properties and this one isn't at the same level. Don't get me wrong it isn't a holiday inn, but if I hadn't found such a good rate at this hotel and had paid $350 a night I would have been extremely disappointed. The rooms were nicely appointed but the hallways were dank and smelled of mildew. The public areas are nice but some need work. The biggest advantage was its proximity to the festivities during the 4th of July. I will stay here again if I can find a decent rate.
reviews.title: Great Locations for the 4th of July

reviews.text: I planned an impromptu trip into Boston to spend time with my daughter. I booked the room two days ahead of time on Priceline - this gives one access to the Fairmont Room category (king or queen bed / smaller rooms).
reviews.title: One of the nicest rooms I have stayed in for quite some time...

reviews.text: When we checked in I asked for a room with 2 double beds and was accomodated - the double bedded rooms are in the Deluxe category which affords a more spacious room.
reviews.title: Fairmont --- Great Location

reviews.text: I have to say that the hotel looked fantastic from the time we entered, the lobby, the elevators, the hallways, and in particular our room and bathroom. Our room was huge. It was a corner room at the back of the hotel (not on the Westin side of the hotel - on the opposite side which is next to a side street and the Prudential tower), it was at the end of the hallway, not near a stairwell, and was very quiet. (Room number was 301 in case that is helpful to anyone).
reviews.title: The old gal ain't what she used to be

reviews.text: This room had windows on two sides, two very comfortable double beds with very nice linens and pillows. The room and bathroom were spotless. There was a beautiful fireplace and mantle, a desk, a comfortable club chair and the entertainment center which housed the TV and minibar. The bathroom was enormous - probably about 12 feet by 10 feet. It was a large tub, sink with granite counter, toilet, 2 bathrobes, all marble.... very updated, large and nicely appointed.
reviews.title: Quite surprising

reviews.text: I must say I was really impressed when I stepped into the hotel. I felt like I was in a European Chateau, with all the chandeliers and marble. Unfortunately, my feeling changed once I got to my room. The room is very small, so small the TV has to be put on the side wall (making it very difficult to watch), and closet only fits a few items. And the noise level is unbearable. I could hear the door slams and ice machine (although my room was a good 70 feet from it), not to mention the conversation of my neighbors. In addition, the phone was not connected even 1 hour after I checked in (I had to call reception to have it fixed) and the pay movie channel was not working the whole time I was there (2 nights). Overall, as beautiful as the hotel is, I would not go back again unless the paper-thin wall is fixed.
reviews.title: great location and decor, but...
Fairmont Friendly and Fantastic

Drinks in the Oak Room is the perfect way to end a fine meal in the neighborhood. The drink list is fantastic with some funky creations such as The Blond Bombshell and the POPs martini.

reviews.title: Pretty fancy
Smart hotel but everything at a cost
reviews.text: There is no question that this is a lovely, beautifully and ornately decorated hotel with elegantly and comfortably furnished rooms. The tariffs are high, and for that you get the room and use of the fitness centre. This is the third hotel I stayed in during a 2 week part business, part leisure trip to Boston. Compared to the other 2, also in the Copley Square vicinity (and to be reviewed separately), the Fairmont somewhat lacks a personal touch. There is no complimentary bottled water. It is available for purchase at $7 + tax + 10% restocking for a 1L bottle. There is no facility for making coffee/tea in the room and there is a $25 charge for emptying the minibar to make room if you want it for your own use. No little touches such as cotton wool balls or newspaper either and breakfast/room service seems a little steep, although probably appropriately priced for a joint like this. Internet is complimentary if you are a President's club member (free to join) but is frustrating as you have to reconnect every other minute. Some of the doormen appear to be averse to opening doors for you. Being in a room overlooking the central 'courtyard' that houses the fire escape and air conditioning unit, the view leaves much to be desired but the consolation is that there is no street noise and the sleep quality has been quite good. I have to say, this probably wouldn't be my first choice of hotel when I come back to Boston, given the other hotels around here. I can see the attraction if you are on a romantic and indulgent weekend away. Having said that, the conference facilities here have been good.

reviews.title: Gracious Stay
reviews.text: As a member of the Present's Club with "rewards" from the nights I stayed last year, We booked a suite for four days of dining, walking and museums.. A very large gracious space with an entry foyer, large bathroom, separate closet room and two beautiful rooms with antique and reproduction furniture from the early 20th century. We kept waiting for Teddy Roosevelt to join us. Check in and all other staff encounters were polite and professional. The location which permits easy strolling to Newbury and Commonwealth, the Commons and both the Back Bay and Beacon Hill areas is hard to beat.Thankfully, if you are looking for modern, flashy, hip and loud this will not be your cup of tea. It is not and hopefully never will be those.

reviews.title: Outstanding
reviews.text: My family recently travelled to Boston for a mini vacation and to catch a Red Sox game (my daughter is a huge Red Sox fan). We decided to stay right in Boston and chose the Fairmont Copley and it was one of the best travel decisions I have ever made! The staff of this hotel were nothing short of outstanding! From the person meeting us as we drove up to the front entrance of the hotel, to the front desk staff to the concierge to the Oak Bar staff, the maid service and even the Valet's, I have never experienced this exceptional level of service in over 25 years of both business and personal travel. Do yourself a favour. If you get a chance stay in this hotel. You won't regret it!

reviews.title: for VERY special occasions only
reviews.text: We were there for a wedding (in the hotel itself). The rooms were really nothing special. Even with an event discount, a 2 night stay for 2 was close to $700.00. Parking was not included even though we were guests at the hotel. We liked the location; though if we were not there for the wedding, we would probably stayed at a hotel in a different location

reviews.title: Watch out for the Oak Room Restaurant
reviews.text: During a recent stay at this hotel, at which I have stayed several times in the past, my wife and I decided to dine one evening at the Oak Room which is the main hotel restaurant. Having eaten here several times during past visits, and always to our satisfaction, this time was a disaster. The room was crowded and the wait staff was inadequate to handle the volume present. Although seated promptly, we waited for about 25 minutes before being approached by our waiter(I was just about to walk out). No greeting,just handed us menus and said something about he'll be back. He then did reappear and took our drink orders. I asked for a wine menu which did not appear. eventually he did come back for our food orders and on being asked a third time ,did bring the wine list. Asked for a particular wine and prodded by him to just give him the number. Comes back three minutes later, thrusts the wine list back at me and says pick another. No explanation.

I have not been back since 10 years ago. Came back again for business and was booked at this hotel again by my company. The room has been beautifully appointed, even though it's on the small size, but adequate. However, as I mentioned in my last review on this hotel, the wall is still thin and voice travels from hallway and next door (my room, 532, was right next to the service elevator, so I could hear the bell ringing every time it stopped on my floor). And the water pressure is still weak (my colleague describes it as "old-man peeing"). This is all due to the age of the building, so I don't think it will be changed. And that's the reason I would not pick this hotel if I have a choice.
reviews.title: Not my first choice

reviews.text: Service-wise, I find it hit-and-miss. Some I find are truly friendly and willing to go above and beyond. Some are just going through the motion, saying all the right things, but action and attitude do not match.
reviews.title: A wonderful gem in Back Bay!

reviews.text: Truly exceptional service. Even the porters are perfect. This kind of training isn't accidental -- they must work at it. Also loved the location, of course -- great view of Copley Square and walking distance to everything. Public rooms are stunning. Very nice cafe bar with great food. Super room service. Nice touch -- nothing to sign on the room service delivery; the receipt is in a small envelope. Only complaints were minor -- couldn't make steamed milk for a room service latte (they only had one machine & it was on the fritz); not enough water pressure for the big showerhead to work well. But overall very enjoyable & a good value too.
reviews.title: Pleasant, charming and comfortable stay, great location in Boston.

reviews.text: We have stayed in the Copley Plaza many times, even before it was a fairmont. But clearly the best stays at the Copley Plaza have been during the Fairmont years. The lobby is lush with its hih ceilings the grand entrance hall from st james ave. and the decor on the gold floor is warm and luxurious, but not in your face as the lobby may seem to a first time Copley guest. The room has a beautiful chandelier and comfy beds, not to mention the great all marble bathroom. The room has a huge window overlooking the square with a large sit-in window sill. The Oak Room downstairs has delicious steak and a classical ambiance. The service of the whole hotel is unparalleled. They even set up my son's stuffed animals on the bed. The private gold floor check in was speedy and our bags arrived within five minutes. The maid even left us a Christmas card on the nigh of Christmas Eve (turndown is also complimentary :)). The Copley Plaza is a must stay in Boston.

Granted, his is an older property, I think it is in need of a refurbishment. Pros: location is great, gorgeous lobby and public spaces. Cons: tiny room, cordless phone didn't work, old receptacle in the wall needed a cover plate, soundproofing not the best, was supposed to get a daily paper given my membership in their President's club but did not for 3 days, despite 2 days of mentioning it at the front desk. Given so many other lovely hotels in that area, I would not stay here again.

reviews.title: Not worth the money
reviews.text: This hotel is beautiful and the staff is attentive. Our concierge was wonderful. The room was good size but there was really no place to sit except the bed. A sofa would have been nice. The food in the restaurant and in room service was average at best and there are very few amenities. For $400/night I would think they might have a swimming pool or a spa…or even gourmet dining. The location was great, but there are other (less expensive) hotels in the same location. We will be trying one of those out next time. I would not pay more than $250/night for this hotel.

reviews.title: Fine But Nothing Special
reviews.text: We were in town for a Red Sox game and chose the Fairmont Copley because we like the brand and the price was excellent. Check in was easy, the hotel occupies a beautiful old building and the staff was friendly. We booked a room overlooking the park, which was clean and comfortable, but not all that big, and the view was urban and not all that interesting. There was an odd energy to the room and the floor, (and we felt more comfortable leaving the bathroom light on after dark!) The hotel is convenient to the Back Bay and Fenway.

reviews.title: Newly Renovated Rooms
reviews.text: We had appetizers and drinks in the Oak Room which were fine, but there is much better to be found close by. In fact, we had dinner at Grill 23 which is only a couple blocks away, and which was amazing.

reviews.text: The hotel is often a very good value, but don't set your expectations too high. It was clean, friendly, and that's about it. Be sure to double check your bill at check out.

reviews.title: Fairmont was Fantastic
reviews.text: Stayed at the Fairmont Copley Plaza 7/4-7/6/06. Booked the "Only One Way Summer Campaign" rate on the Fairmont website. For $195/night, we were given a very large room with a comfy king-sized bed, a large work desk, and a fireplace. The room was beautifully decorated, and the bathroom felt high-end (with separate toilet, shower, and vanity areas). Nice toiletries and bathrobes. The staff was very helpful with directions and suggestions. The Copley Plaza location was ideal for touring the city. Close to the subway. One of the best hotels we've stayed in. Highly recommended.

About an hour before game-time we received a knock on the door. They brought us a fresh plate of fruit to much on while we were getting ready for the baseball game! The staff member even mentioned that they were hoping we'd be up from our nap!

My husband and I stayed 5 nights at this hotel to celebrate our 35th wedding anniversary. We booked a room on the Gold Level. When we checked in we were told we had been upgraded to a signature room. The room was very large and overlooked the square. We were personally shown to our room and on the table was a bottle of champagne and fruit and flowers which we thought was a lovely touch. Being on the gold floor gave us access to all the lounges which were beautifully decorated. Breakfast was complimentary and so were soft drinks, tea and coffe all day. In the evening there were tasty snacks put out. Some of the days we ate so much we did not need any dinner! There are only about 56 rooms on the gold floor and this gives you the idea that this is a hotel within a hotel. The lounges were very relaxing to come back to after a day of sightseeing. I must say that if you did not stay on the gold level there are no lounges in the main part of the hotel. Although there is a very nice bar and restaurant which we tried. If we went back to Boston we would stay there again, but only on the gold level. If anyone wants any more info let me know. My email is ruthlfraser@hotmail.com

reviews.text: The title of my review says it all. This is a beautiful, grand old hotel. It's very impressive. The rooms were large and very clean. Beautiful marble in the bathroom. Flat screen tvs, internet hook-ups. Lots of charm. And then you go into the lobby and have to deal with a) someone at the front desk or b) someone in the Oak Room Bar. Rude, snotty, sullen and downright nasty about sums it up. Neither my husband nor I could believe that such a beautiful "grand dame" of a hotel has a staff as rude as the conglomeration of thugs at the Fairmont Copley Plaza. Not sure what's going on there but, if not for the staff, this place would be a home run.
reviews.title: Exceptional hotel; exceptionally rude staff

reviews.text: In terms of location, the Copley Plaza is in the perfect spot. This is especially true in the summer when there are summer markets in the square. The hotel has nice rooms and is reminiscent of a time that has past (although the rooms have all been updated and are complete with modern amenities). This is particularly true in the lobby as well as the Oak Room. While the hotel is very nice, I would not go so far to say it is anything out of this world (hence the 4/5 stars). However, if friends were going to Boston, I'd definitely recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We originally booked the Fairmont Battery Wharf for our stay but decided to return to their Copley Place location at the last minute because I prefer the location. I didn't want to pay the $42/night parking fee since I don't use my car in Boston so I was fortunate enough to be able to leave my car at a friends outside of Boston and take the commuter rail into town. After getting off at North Station it is only 1.5 blocks to the Fairmont so it is very convienient. We were at first given a Gold room with no view because it was the only one ready but after declining that room we were given the room we had during our last stay which has a nice location. The Gold level rooms come with Breakfast and some appetizers in the evening. The breakfast was very good and included some hot items as well as fruit, yogurt, etc.. The evening snacks were good and the wines/drinks are inexpensive and served on an honor system. The Breakfast and evening snacks are served in the Gold Lounge. The lounge also has a business center dedicated to the Gold level rooms.
reviews.title: Still Desireable Place/Location

reviews.text: We found the service to be first rate as usual. While this Fairmont was designed by the same person who built the Fairmont Plaza in NYC, and both are beautiful, I find that hotel to be somewhat more updated in room features.

reviews.title: First Class Service
Not impressed
reviews.text: We booked in to the Fairmont for a 4 night weekend getaway. The room itself was lovely but the basic amenities you would expect for that price range were noticably absent. There is no coffee in the room, no hair dryer in the bathroom, no full sized mirror and our window looked straight at courtyard full of air conditioning vents. To order in a pot of coffee for the morning was over $20 after taxes and tips and there is no other place in the hotel to pop down to get take out. I have no objection at all to paying top dollar for good value.... there was just too much missing here to justify the price.... and I hate having to keep the drapes closed because the view is so bad! My husband crossed the street to the Westin where he was able to pick up two Star Bucks coffees to go for just over $2. He ended up booking a 22nd floor room (which had coffee, mirrors, hairdryers and a stupendous view of the square) for $100 less per night. We used the $300 savings to book Father's Day seats at the Sox game right behind home plate. Now THAT was a good value!

reviews.text: All this would have been fine but what really left me annoyed was the desk staff. They were hopeless. Very young, and clearly in need of training (they mastered 'Hello Mr ____' whenever I walked by, a curious feature of upper level American hotels which always leaves me unnerved - what's wrong with 'sir'?). I checked in at about 5pm only to be told that my room wasn't ready and I'd have to wait an hour. This is pretty poor form for 5pm by which time the rooms should really have been turned around - especially with a check in time of 3pm advertised. Did they offer me a free drink in the bar with a newspaper whilst I waited? Somewhere to sit? (bear in mind it was FREEZING outside) Anything at all? Nope. Even the worst B&B in the world would give you a cup of tea and the local paper rather than send you out onto the streets.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I returned in an hour and the room STILL wasn't ready. So I waited in the lobby on a chair, still not being offered any apology or refreshment, but able to make eyes at 'Catie Copley' the hotel's 'Canine Ambassador' (that's Boston soi-disant-posh for 'dog'). I was clearly considered a huge annoyance for arriving at 5pm - two hours after my paid for room was meant to be available to me. All I wanted was a shower and a gin.
reviews.title: Historic hotel in great location

aka: The Fairmont Copley Plaza Boston Hotel Boston
description: The Fairmont Copley Plaza has been a symbol of Boston's rich history and elegance since its gala opening in 1912. Centrally located in beautiful Back Bay, this luxury hotel is just steps from many popular historic sites, as well as the celebrated boutiques on Newbury Street. Our dedicated staff delivers incomparable hospitality, impeccable service and attention to detail to ensure your stay is perfect. Now, with the April 2012 completion of an extensive renovation of each of the hotel’s 383 well-appointed guestrooms and suites, the restoration of the ballrooms and public spaces, and the addition of a contemporary, rooftop health club, The Fairmont Copley Plaza shines more brightly than ever before.
